newsitem.title: ITALY: Six bids to proceed in sale of Italy's SEAT.
newsitem.headline: Six bids to proceed in sale of Italy's SEAT.

text.p: Six bids have been admitted for consideration in the final phase of the process to privatise Italian yellow pages telephone directory group SEAT SpA, Lehman Brothers International (Europe) said in a statement on Tuesday.
It said the bidders include a unit of GTE Corp and a consortium including Banca Commerciale Italiana SpA.

Lehman Brothers, financial consultants to the Italian Treasury on the sale, published the short list in a statement after the Treasury said it had asked Lehman Brothers to proceed with the final stage of the operation.
The statement said the bidders had six weeks from February 24 to submit definitive offers.

R.R. Donnelley & Sons Company; ITT Information Services Inc; GTE Corp unit GTE Directories Corp; Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Merchant Banking II Inc and Europe Capital Partners S.A.; Blackstone Capital Partners II Merchant Banking Fund L.P.; a consortium of Banca Commerciale Italiana SpA, Bain Capital Inc, BC European Capital V.L.P., Editoriale L'Espresso SpA, Investitori Associati II S.A. and Istituto Geografico De Agostini di Novara SpA.
SEAT was floated off from state-controlled telecoms group Stet at the beginning of this year with state industrial holding IRI holding a 61 percent stake.
